title: Triager/Team members can edit  hacker's report and hacker is not even notified

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**

Hi Team
I have created a dummy program and I noticed that Triager/Team member can edit hacker's report.
**If you say this is a feature for the team, there should be a mechanism to ask permission  from hacker to edit the report **

### Steps To Reproduce

1.  Create a dummy report
2.  Open the report as team member
3.  You will see a edit option near hacker's report
4.  Using that option edit the report

â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

## Impact

A triager/team member may edit hacker's report which highly impact the integrity of the report as there is no way hacker can proof that whether his submitted report was edited or not as you can see I have changed the whole content of the report and it also not notifying that the report has been updated

activities.message:
Hi @hackeronestaff,

Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Have a great day! 

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi Aaron

I am not sure so sure of whether triager can edit the report or not but organization team member can edit the report.

Thanks
Abhinav

Hey @hackeronestaff,

Thank you for your report!

After review, there doesnâ€™t seem to be any significant security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing.

The user has permission to perform those actions. To check the permissions, I commented on the test report and checked the username
{F2487022} 

Now visit `https://hackerone.com/organizations/YOUR_ORG_NAME/settings/users` and check that user's permission
â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

Please don't raise a vulnerability for above screenshots, this is for your understanding.

As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report.

This will not have any impact on your Signal or Reputation score. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @h1_analyst_aaron 

I am sorry buddy but there seems to be some confusion. I want to address few points:--

1. I have checked the documentation and I don't see any permission that allow program admins or any to** hacker's original report**. They can only edit/change report state, title and vulnerability type. There is no mention that a team member can edit the entire report.
{F2487066} 
â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

2. The screenshot you shared, it shows that you tried to comment on a report and then edited it. But the vulnerability that I reported is a team member can edit the** entire report** submitted by the a hacker.

I request you to recheck the details.

Thanks
Abhinav

Hello @hackeronestaff,
I hope you are doing well.

Thank you for the information.
Could you please try the steps that I have mentioned in my previous comment and share screenshots or video PoC ?

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @h1_analyst_aaron 

I am sorry but I don't quite follow which steps you are talking about.
I visited ```https://hackerone.com/organizations/skill_demo/settings/users/``` and I have provided the screenshot above. Sharing It again here.
â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ
**I can't remove myself as admin as it's giving me warning that I can loss control from the program**
 >To check the permissions, I commented on the test report and checked the username

From what I understand, here you tried to comment on a report. I am not clear what you mean by that.


##What I think is the bug??
It should not be allowed to edit a hacker's original report by any organization/company team members. 
Is it permissible for team members to modify a hacker's original report, for example, changing the reported issue from XYZ to ABC?
I am sharing a screenshot, in which I was able to edit the report submitted by @demo-hacker 
{F2491200}
â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

Looking forward to hear from you.ðŸ™‚

Thanks
Abhinav

Hello @hackeronestaff,
I hope you are doing well.

Thank you for the information.
As per `â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ` screenshot, there's only one user present and that user has all the permissions, most importantly the `Organization administrator` that's the reason why you were able to perform edit actions.

Please remove those permissions or invite another user with low permissions and try to edit the report. If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report.

Thank you for understanding.

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_aaron

Hi @h1_analyst_aaron 

I am sorry for the delay but I am in contact with the support team so that I can provide a better POC.
{F2526979}

Thanks
Abhinav

Hi @h1_analyst_aaron 

Check this report https://hackerone.com/reports/2096271
This was the exact same issue that I reported but you closed it informative. What should I do now??
Even the title is still the same

Hi! Thanks for letting us know about this,

I will investigate more thoroughly sooner, though we also got word that #2012469 describes a similar (though not identical) vulnerability.

The hacker in  #2012469 has opted to request mediation, I will grant them access to this report too in the event they need to view it.

nevermind: mediation was already requested.

Hi @zerotea 

Appreciate the update and your dedication to fairness. Open communication is key.ðŸ™‚
Additionally, would it be possible to grant me access to #2012469? Being aware of the situation/discussion will save both of us time in case of a duplication of my report. 

Thanks
Abhinav

Hi @abhhinavsecondary,

We've opted for the following ruling:

- #2012469 (partial duplicate in good faith, low severity)
- #2061367 (full duplicate)
www.hackerone.com is our blog, you meant to target hackerone.com so the CVSS score lines up properly ;)

To comment on our fix:

We removed the permissions from Program Members and Triage, and had backlogged audit logs for report body changes as a future improvement.

Hi @zerotea 

Grateful for the bounty and the swift resolution of the duplicate issue. 
Can we disclose the report now?? Kindly redact image id â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ (triager's email id is visible)

Thanks
Abhinav
For sure, thanks for flagging this to us!

Hi @zerotea 

My email id is also left disclosed â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ. please redirected it 

Thanks
Abhinav
Done! Sorry, I missed that one :(
We awarded $500 to the researcher in #2129933 for reporting this first to us.

summaries.content: This report is identical to https://hackerone.com/reports/2096271, but was reporter earlier. As result, we have retroactively awarded the hacker.

user.name: zerotea
